item.description:
Restaurant: Punjab, 485 Mass Ave, Arlington. No buffet, but a nice selection of lunch foods! Parking in a large municipal lot just behind the restaurant (enter from Route 60).

No, we are not reading the entire nine volumes.... R. K. Narayan, the author of our shortened prose version, points out that the Mahabharata is the longest epic in literature, eight times longer than the Iliad and the Odyssey combined! The story tells of conflict in a ruling family in ancient India... culminating in a great battle. The longer versions of the books include many lengthy side stories, but those stories are cut (or synopsized in a line or two) in this shortened version.

In a few months, we will read the other great Indian epic, the Ramayana.

Here is a link to the book on Amazon:
http://www.amazon.com...

Note: you can find many other versions! If you choose to read some other version (and you are welcome to do so!), the main story line will be the same, but some details will differ.
item.name: November 2010 - The Mahabharata, by R.K. Narayan
